db:article.db:para: Threading is a collection of QML multithreading examples.

db:section.db:title: Running the Example
db:section.db:para: To run the example from Qt Creator, open the Welcome mode and select the example from Examples. For more information, visit Building and Running an Example.

db:section.db:title: Threaded ListModel
db:section.db:para: Threaded ListModel contains a ListView and a ListModel. The ListModel object is updated asynchronously in another thread, and the results propagate back to the main thread. A timer requests updates from the worker thread periodically:
Inside the worker thread, the ListModel is synchronized once the data is finished loading:

db:section.db:title: WorkerScript
db:section.db:para: WorkerScript contains an example of using a WorkerScript to offload expensive calculations into another thread. This keeps the UI from being blocked. This example calculates numbers in Pascal's Triangle, and not in a very optimal way, so it will often take several seconds to complete the calculation. By doing this in a WorkerScript in another thread, the UI is not blocked during this time.
When the UI needs another value, a request is sent to the WorkerScript:
The workerscript then is free to take a really long time to calculate it:
When it's done, the result returns to the main scene via the WorkerScript type:
